primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God intervenes in human suffering and social exclusion to create a 'spacious place' of well-being, enabling the community to endure the 'ordinary' with a defiant 'yet'.

tekstueel_bewijs: He turned the sea into dry land
He has kept us among the living
God has broken the world open to well-being
you have brought us into a spacious place
God will make this a place of shalom

zender.identificatie: The God of the 'Awesome Deeds' (The Biblical Tradition)
tekstueel_bewijs: the amazing rule of God that defies the facts on the ground

ontvanger.identificatie: The Excluded / The Hearers / The Lepers
tekstueel_bewijs: for lepers and for all those who are excluded
He has not rejected my prayer
remember the extraordinary goodness of God
helper.rol_van_god: God is the primary Subject; Christ is the active agent in the Gospel narrative.

tegenstander.identificatie: The 'Facts on the Ground' / Exclusion / Sin as Banishment
tekstueel_bewijs: banishments for some of the same reasons, of gays, immigrants, Muslims
the world is a troubled place
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad habits but systemic exclusion, disease (leprosy), and the 'empire' that chains the gospel.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The community of faith responds to God's action by enduring, telling the truth, and practicing shalom.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: People of Faith / The Church
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The 'Yet' (human endurance) is explicitly grounded in God's 'Awesome Deeds' (divine action).

voorbeelden_god_subject: He turned the sea into dry land
God has broken the world open
voorbeelden_mens_subject: people of faith look reality in the face
I will remember to give thanks
we have signed on with this news

voorbeelden: get on with the task of ministry
I will be seen in public as one of your people
remember the wondrous gifts of God
tell the truth about the present
the word of God is not chained
God is reliable and will give you life

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes God's 'ability' (Pouvoir) to act in impossible situations, which then grants the hearer the 'competence' to endure.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (trouble) through the negation of ~S2 (refusing easy romanticism) to S1 (the spacious place) via the 'Yet' of God.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the 'Yet'—the divine intervention that transforms S2 into S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. The sermon lists wars, oil spills, and systemic racism as real 'fire and water'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is fundamentally theocentric. Human endurance is presented as a derivative of divine reliability. The 'Subject' of the primary transformation is consistently God/Jesus.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Paul says to the church, 'Quit quarreling... get on with the task'

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: It is the power of God that reaches into unacceptable places... and makes all things new.
leprosy was a deep threat... they could not control it

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: While biblical figures are mentioned, they are 'witnesses' to God's action rather than models of human effort.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides this: 'God saves like He saved Naaman.'

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and empowerment; the burden of 'making it happen' is shifted to God.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic restoration leading to synergistic endurance.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'Awesome Deeds' (Soteriology) to the 'Yet' of the church (Ethics/Endurance) is logically and theologically tight.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'God tested us' and 'God is reliable'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: God has broken the world open... the word of God is not chained.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses on the 'Word' and 'Memory' as the means of grace rather than the person of the Spirit.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: High; sin is seen as exclusion, banishment, and the 'jungle' of the world.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject of the 'Awesome Deeds' while positioning the hearer as the Receiver who is then empowered to be a secondary Subject of endurance.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Explicitly mention how the Holy Spirit provides the 'Pouvoir' to endure when memory fails.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Strongly defined as systemic and physical chaos.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterclass in theocentric preaching. It avoids moralism by grounding every human 'must' or 'can' in a prior divine 'did'.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'Yet' as a stylistic device; Greimas shows it is the pivot of the actantial shift from Opponent to Subject.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the lectionary; Greimas shows how these disparate texts share a single deep-structure narrative of divine liberation.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Spacious Place' is not just a metaphor but the 'Object' of value that God (Subject) transmits to the Excluded (Receiver).

volledige_subject_lijst: God (tested, tried, brought, let, turned, kept, has not rejected, will make, has brought)
People of faith (look, deny, endure, watch, remember, tell, trust, pray)
appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Yet' as a semiotic bridge between the state of Lack (S2) and the state of Fulfillment (S1).
